message.content:
We start by looking at the two facts that mention our people. From the list we have:

• “Diane is Martha’s descendant.” 
  This tells us that Martha is an ancestor in that branch (Martha → … → Diane).

• “Stephanie is Amy’s descendant.”
  This tells us that Amy is an ancestor in a separate branch (Amy → … → Stephanie).

There is no statement connecting any descendant or ancestor in Martha’s branch with anyone in Amy’s branch. In other words, from the provided information there is no known linkage (neither a common ancestor nor a common descendant between the two branches, nor a direct relationship where one is the ancestor/descendant of the other).

Thus, none of the answers (sharing a common ancestor, one being an ancestor/descendant of the other, or sharing a common descendant) is known to be correct.

The correct answer is:

<ANSWER>5</ANSWER>
